comments: A246435(n) = (number of digits in a(n)) = A055642(a(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 05 2014
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
J. S. Tanton, A collection of research problems
formula: To represent a number in base b, if a digit exceeds b, subtract b and carry 1. In fractional base a/b, subtract a and carry b.
example: Representations of the first few numbers are:0 = 01 = 12 = 23 = 2 04 = 2 15 = 2 26 = 2 1 07 = 2 1 18 = 2 1 29 = 2 1 0 010 = 2 1 0 1
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, a[ Quotient[n, 3] 2] 10 + Mod[ n, 3]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 18 2014 *)
prog: (Sage)def base32Expansion(n):    L=[n]    i=1    while L[i-1]>2:        x=L[i-1]        L[i-1]=x.mod(3)        L.append(2*floor(x/3))        i+=1    L.reverse()    T=Integer(join([str(x) for x in L],''))    return T[base32Expansion(y) for y in [0..50]] # - _Tom Edgar_, _Hailey R. Olafson_, and _James Van Alstine_, Jun 17 2014{a(n) = if( n<1, 0, a(n\3 * 2) * 10 + n%3)}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jun 18 2014 */(Haskell)a024629 0 = 0a024629 n = 10 * a024629 (2 * n') + t where (n', t) = divMod n 3-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Sep 05 2014
